title_sort: walt whitman to william michael rossetti, 19 october 1875
title: Walt Whitman to William Michael Rossetti, 19 October 1875
text: 431 Stevens St. / Camden, N. Jersey. / U.S. America19 October 1875. My dear Mr. Rossetti,Let me by this introduce to you an old and valued friend of mine, J. B. Marvin, who is making a short visit to London on business.Mr. Marvin is a New Englander, literary, democratic, has a family, and has a position in the Treasury at Washington.I still continue here, laid up, but working a very little. Best wishes, congratulations etc. on the marriage. Kindest respects to Mrs. Rossetti. I have lately received a good kind letter from Tennyson. Write soon and freely. I am pretty lonesome here.Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to William Michael Rossetti, 19 October 1875
